entities.name: dobby
entities.description: Dobby is a house-elf who is speaking and gesturing in the background. He points to something behind Mr. Malfoy's back.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as someone who might have been blamed for Ginny's actions if she had taken the blame.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is Harry's friend and is mentioned as someone who hadn't discovered the book.

entities.name: ginny weasley
entities.description: Ginny is Arthur Weasley's daughter and a Muggle-born. She might have taken all the blame for something if Harry hadn't been here.

entities.name: mr malfoy
entities.description: Mr. Malfoy is speaking and trying to maintain a mask-like face. He is mentioned as someone who would be affected by Ginny's actions.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is speaking and explaining the consequences of what might have happened if Ginny had taken all the blame.

entities.name: arthur weasley
entities.description: Arthur Weasley is mentioned as someone who would be affected by his daughter's actions.

entities.name: riddle
entities.description: Tom Riddle (also known as Lord Voldemort) is mentioned as the one whose memories were wiped from the diary.

relationships.description: Dumbledore explains what might have happened if Harry hadn't been there.
Mr. Malfoy is concerned about the effect of Ginny's actions on his family.
Dumbledore mentions Tom Riddle (Lord Voldemort) as someone whose memories were wiped from the diary.
